## States

|                   | Data valid? | Same as in memory? | Multiple copies? |
| ----------------- | ----------- | ------------------ | ---------------- |
| **M (Modified)**  | Y           | N                  | Y                |
| **E (Exclusive)** | Y           | Y                  | N                |
| **S (Shared)**    | Y           | Y                  | Y                |
| **I (Invalid)**   | N           | -                  | -                |

### Exclusive

The cache line is present only in the current cache, but is clean - it matches main memory. It may be changed to the Shared state at any time, in response to a read request. Alternatively, it may be changed to the Modified state when writing to it.

Only Core 0 visits variable x 

$\to$ The state of its cache line is **E (Exclusive)**.

### Shared

Indicates that this cache line may be stored in other caches of the machine and is clean - it matches the main memory. The line may be discarded (changed to the Invalid state) at any time.

Core 0, Core 1, and Core 2 all visit variable x 

$\to$ The state of their corresponding cache lines are **S (Shared)**.

### Modified & Invalid

- **Modified**

  The cache line is present only in the current cache, and is dirty - it has been modified (M state) from the value in main memory. The cache is required to write the data back to main memory at some time in the future, before permitting any other read of the (no longer valid) main memory state. The write-back changes the line to the Shared state(S).

- **Invalid**

  Indicates that this cache line is invalid (unused).

$\to$ The state of its cache line in Core 0 is set to **M (Modified)**. Cache lines in other cores are set to **I (Invalid)**.

## State Diagram (from Lecture)

<img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EckoTan0804/upic-repo/master/uPic/2020-07-30%2011.09.38.png" alt="2020-07-30 11.09.38" style="zoom: 67%;" />

- shared: Copies of this data also exist in other processor's cache.
- $\neg$shared: This data ONLY exist in this processor's cache.

<img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EckoTan0804/upic-repo/master/uPic/2020-07-30%2011.10.14.png" alt="2020-07-30 11.10.14" style="zoom: 67%;" />

### Bsp (Aufg. 2.1)

- Ein Multiprozessorsystem besteht aus drei Prozessoren, die uber einen gemeinsamen Spei- cher gekoppelt sind.
- Die Caches haben je eine Groe von zwei Cachezeilen, welche je genau ein Speicherwort aufnehmen konnen. 
  - Die Fullung des Caches erfolgt von der niedrigs- ten Cachezeile an aufwarts, sofern noch freie Zeilen zur Verfugung stehen, andernfalls wird gema LRU-Strategie verdrangt.
- Cache-Koharenzprotokoll: MESI-Protokoll

<img src="https://raw.githubusercontent.com/EckoTan0804/upic-repo/master/uPic/2020-07-30%2011.13.34.png" alt="2020-07-30 11.13.34" style="zoom:67%;" />

- [MSEI Protocol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/MESI_protocol)
